column5: Figured I'd post this separately so it doesn't get lost in shuffle. Lots of nice scenery, fish, and some cool underwater shots:      Also did a short cabin tour video. It's included in the long video, but again wanted to make sure it doesn't get lost in the shuffle.      Hope you enjoy,   Cheers,  Mike
Again, thanks for taking the time to gather and post.
Thanks a bunch Rob, glad you liked!
Very well done Mike!!!!Looks like a group of four on your trip?Thanks for sharing.
Truly spectacular!! Thanks for sharing Mike!

Thanks guys. I'm really not a pro when it comes to video in fact my 10 year old daughter can do better. I'm still learning how to use this program and I know there's a few glaring errors with the soundtrack and some of the title pages.  I'll learn quick though, the videos will only get better.

very nice!! i could just feel a sense of excitement and anticipation as the plane was coming in!!  Nice one in the cradle!I guess it doesn't get that big by being a fussy eater!!  Video quality is fine---I don't know how you manage it at all and still play that guitar!!
awesome lakers and video and cabin congrats mike
That's awesome! I really want to do a fly in for trout one day, thanks for the motivation!
Looks great. Kind of place I want to run to.
And here I thought Mike was back, till I caught the date.
I sure do miss Mike's posts!! How can we get him back?
Wow, well done and thank you so much for sharing!
Solopaddler drops in from time to time.  You can check out his videos on Youtube under 'canadianfishingguide'.
Thanks for the video Mike looking great.  Art
Whoops!  The Youtube channel is 'Canada Fishing Guide'.  More importantly, all of Mike's trip reports can be found at his website http://www.canadafishingguide.net
LOL...you are living MY DREAM Mike...stop it!  Good work again, love all the videos, you get to go to some amazing places.....RESPECT!
